what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: dataset contains borehole forensic pumping test data, capturing key parameters related groundwater extraction, borehole performance, water quality assessments. includes information test conditions, water levels, pumping rates, flow measurement methods, water quality indicators pH, turbidity, electrical conductivity. dataset also documents permissions granted testing, equipment used, observations borehole performance, whether water level stabilized pumping whether borehole passed test. Potential Uses Dataset 1. Hydrogeological Analysis: Evaluating groundwater availability borehole efficiency. 2. Environmental Studies: Assessing water quality parameters. 3. Infrastructure Planning: Supporting water resource management borehole maintenance decisions. 4. Regulatory Compliance: Ensuring boreholes meet required operational standards.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version boreholeforensicspumpingtest GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table . Click Download CSV. window opens displays CSV browser. Right-click anywhere inside window select “Save Page …”. Save file folder choice.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("openwashdata/boreholeforensicspumpingtest") ## Run the following code in console if you don't have the packages ## install.packages(c("dplyr", "knitr", "readr", "stringr", "gt", "kableExtra")) library(dplyr) library(knitr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(gt) library(kableExtra)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: package provides access Borehole Forensics 4 - Pumping Test conducted 2018 2024

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: dataset boreholeforensicspumpingtest contains data … 203 observations 44 variables overview variable names, see following table.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: library(boreholeforensicspumpingtest) library(ggplot2) library(lubridate)  # Convert date_of_survey_or_test to Date format and extract year boreholeforensicspumpingtest$year <- year(mdy(boreholeforensicspumpingtest$date_of_survey_or_test))  # Create the plot ggplot(boreholeforensicspumpingtest, aes(x = year, y = static_water_level_metres_below_reference_point_before_start_of_test)) +   geom_point() +   theme_minimal() +   labs(     title = "Static Water Level by Year",     x = "Year",     y = "Static Water Level (m below reference point)"   )

what: boreholeforensicspumpingtest: Borehole Forensics 4 - Pumping Test — boreholeforensicspumpingtest
title: boreholeforensicspumpingtest: Borehole Forensics 4 - Pumping Test — boreholeforensicspumpingtest
text: dataset contains borehole forensic pumping test data, capturing key parameters related groundwater extraction, borehole performance, water quality assessments. includes information test conditions, water levels, pumping rates, flow measurement methods, water quality indicators pH, turbidity, electrical conductivity.

title: boreholeforensicspumpingtest: Borehole Forensics 4 - Pumping Test — boreholeforensicspumpingtest
boreholeforensicspumpingtest: Borehole Forensics 4 - Pumping Test — boreholeforensicspumpingtest
text: tibble 445 rows 38 variables date_of_survey_or_test Date borehole pumping test conducted. is_it_possible_to_complete_pumping_test Indicates whether pumping test successfully completed. specify_why_not_possible_to_complete_pumping_test Reason pumping test completed, applicable. water_point_committee_permission Whether permission granted water point committee conduct test. district_water_office_permission Whether permission granted district water office conduct test. type_of_test type pumping test performed borehole. static_water_level_metres_below_reference_point_before_start_of_test Water level reference point start test (meters). water_level_reference_point reference point used measure water level (e.g., top casing, ground level). other_water_level_reference_point Additional reference point used measuring water level, applicable. reference_level_above_or_below_ground_level_in_miters Measurement reference level relative ground level (meters). pump_intake_depth_in_miters Depth pump intake placed within borehole (meters). total_hole_depth_in_miters Total depth borehole (meters). was_a_water_level_logger_used Indicates whether water level logger used record measurements. was_a_flow_meter_used Indicates whether flow meter used test. other_flow_meter_used Whether alternative flow meter used test. bucket_size_in_litres Capacity bucket used manual flow measurements (liters). index_1 logical index variable internal tracking. time_in_mins Whether time recorded minutes test. water_level_in_mbrp Whether water level measured meters reference point. flowmeter_total Whether total flowmeter reading recorded. flow_rate_in_liters_per_second Whether flow rate measured liters per second. flow_rate_method Whether method used measure flow rate recorded. index_2 second logical index variable internal tracking. time_of_sample_in_min Whether sampling time recorded minutes. ec_in_ms_per_cm Whether electrical conductivity (EC) millisiemens per centimeter recorded. tds_ppt Whether total dissolved solids (TDS) parts per thousand (ppt) recorded. temperature_in_celcius Whether water temperature degrees Celsius recorded. ph Whether pH water measured. turbidity_ntu Whether turbidity nephelometric turbidity units (NTU) measured. Imhoff_cone_cubic_centimeter_per_liter Whether sediment concentration measured using Imhoff cone. did_water_level_stabilise_while_pumping_at_0.25_liters_per_second Whether water level stabilized pumping 0.25 liters per second. established_dwl_at_0.25l_per_second_m Depth water level (DWL) 0.25 liters per second pumping rate (meters). maximum_successful_pumping_rate_in_liters_per_second Highest pumping rate successfully achieved test (liters per second). dwl_at_maximum_pumping_rate Depth water level maximum pumping rate (meters). silt_ejected_during_test Whether silt observed ejected borehole test. did_the_borehole_pass_a_pumping_test Whether borehole passed pumping test based performance criteria. specify_other_borehole_pass_a_pumping_test Additional details borehole's performance pumping test. comments_on_pumping_test Additional comments observations pumping test.
